caption.p: Features of technique types for plant virus detection and diagnostics.

table-wrap-foot.p: Color intensity is proportional to positive qualification.

ELISA, enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay, PCR, polymerase chain reaction; qPCR, quantitative PCR, LAMP, loop-mediated isothermal amplification, RPA, recombinase polymerase amplification; and HTS, high-throughput sequencing.

fn.label: a
fn.p: Versatility. Ability for different detection levels (family, genus, species, strain or isolate).

fn.label: b
fn.p: Multiplexing. Ability to perform parallel analysis (analyze several viruses simultaneously).

fn.label: c
fn.p: Ability to analyze many samples simultaneously.

fn.label: d
fn.p: On-site. Ability to detect viruses on field with portable devices.

fn.label: e
fn.p: Only nanopore sequencing is portable among the HTS techniques.
